My beloved wife  
Norte, December 29, 1835.

Unable to travel by boat, since the President has appointed noon today to meet with the Commission of the Provincial Assembly, of which I am a part, I write to you so that you have no worries about me. Perhaps I will travel today itself in a boat if, after the meeting, there is time for it; but this is uncertain.

Hugs to all our loved ones and goodbye until then,  
Your beloved husband, Almeida.
